sentence: 1. **Joke:** After a whole year my school extestentialist club declared me... ...most likely to be
**Explanation:** The word be can mean to exist (first meaning) or to become (second meaning).
**First new sentence:** I hope to be successful in my career.
**Second new sentence:** I want to be an artist one day.
2. **Joke:** I never knew much about people until I took one apart, just to see how it works.
**Explanation:** The word works can refer to functioning correctly (first meaning) or a place of employment (second meaning).
**First new sentence:** The machine works efficiently after the repairs.
**Second new sentence:** Many people commute to their works in the city.
3. **Joke:** My neighbor is loud and obnoxious now I know how Canada feels
**Explanation:** The word loud can mean having a lot of volume or noise (first meaning) or it can describe someone openly expressing their personality (second meaning).
**First new sentence:** The loud music kept everyone awake at the party.
**Second new sentence:** She has a loud personality that draws everyone’s attention.
